source.acc543e7:
b = df["Pclass"].unique()
b = b.astype("int")
b.sort()
plt.figure(figsize=(20,20))

plt.subplot(2,2,1)
b_ = df.groupby("Pclass")["Survived"].mean()
sns.barplot(x = b , y = b_,data=b_,color="#326B77")
plt.xlabel("Pclass")
plt.ylabel("Survived Mean")
plt.title("Average Life of Pclass ")


plt.subplot(2,2,2)
b__ = df.groupby("Pclass")["Age"].mean()
sns.barplot(x = b , y = b__,data=b__,color="#326B77")
plt.xlabel("Pclass")
plt.ylabel("Age Mean")
plt.title("Average age of pclass")
source.3a45a6f5:
Age_List = np.arange(0,85,7)
count_list = []

for i in range(0,len(Age_List)):
    if(i <= 11):
        i_ = i + 1
    b = df[(df.Age > Age_List[i]) & (df.Age <= Age_List[i_])].count()
    count_list.append(b[0])
    
count_list = count_list[:12]
Age_List = Age_List[1:13]
Age_List = pd.DataFrame(Age_List)
count_list = pd.DataFrame(count_list)
ort = pd.concat([Age_List,count_list],axis = 1)
ort.columns = ["Age","Count"]

plt.figure(figsize=(10,10))
sns.barplot(x = ort.Age , y =ort.Count , data = ort )
source.03848245:
dms = pd.get_dummies(df[["Embarked"]],drop_first=True)
df = df.drop("Embarked",axis =1)
df = pd.concat([df,dms],axis=1)

dms_ = pd.get_dummies(df[["Pclass"]],drop_first=True)
df = df.drop("Pclass",axis =1)
df = pd.concat([df,dms_],axis=1)

df.Sex = preprocessing.LabelEncoder().fit_transform(df.Sex)
#male -> 1
#female -> 0
source.0dd3c20c:
df1 = Titanic_Test.copy()
id_ = df1.PassengerId
df1 = df1.drop("PassengerId",axis =1)
df1 = df1.drop("Ticket",axis =1)
df1 = df1.drop("Cabin",axis =1)
df1 = df1.drop("Name",axis =1)

df1.Age = df1.Age.fillna(df1.Age.median())
df1.Fare = df1.Fare.fillna(df1.Fare.median())
df1.Sex = preprocessing.LabelEncoder().fit_transform(df1.Sex)

dms = pd.get_dummies(df1[["Embarked"]],drop_first=True)
df1 = df1.drop("Embarked",axis =1)
df1 = pd.concat([df1,dms],axis=1)

df1["Pclass"] = df1["Pclass"].astype('category')
dms1 = pd.get_dummies(df1[["Pclass"]],drop_first=True)
df1 = df1.drop("Pclass",axis =1)
df1 = pd.concat([df1,dms1],axis=1)
df1.head()

source.a12993da: C = Cherbourg, Q = Queenstown, S = Southampton
source.8fc0146b:
• Most of the passengers got on from Southampton.
  • There are mostly 3rd class passengers on board.
source.99d96ceb:
• Since the "Age" variable does not have a symmetrical distribution and has extreme values, "NaN" values are filled with Median.
  • Missing data lines have been deleted since the "Embarked" variable contains 2 missing observations and will not cause large data loss in case of deletion.

source.89cd7284: Why is the Gender variable so important?
source.58061d44:
• If we need to interpret the graph, 3rd class passengers make up half of the data we have.
  • It also helps to explain the Survived - Pclass = -0.34 value in the correlation table.
  • As the pclass value increased, the survival rate decreased, so a value of -0.34 emerged.

source.2fb9e360: Data Preview and Eda
source.11df2d1b:
• It is assumed that Passenger Id and Ticket variables do not affect the probability of survival.
  • Since there is no text processing in this study, the Name variable is not included in the study.
  • In order to use the "Cabin" variable effectively, the inner structure of the Titanic must be known and interpreted. In this study, since the "Cabin" variable contains too many missing data, "Cabin" variable will not be taken into account in order not to be misleading.
